intro: Diposis saniculifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diposis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
